results.title: Coordinate graphing 2
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Associates and ACCESS
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mathematics for modern living”.
This episode from the “Mathematics for modern living” series teaches the basics of graphing including the slope of the line, oblique, horizontal and vertical, then progresses onto graphing linear equations (slope intercept method), two firstdegree linear equations and graphing linear inequations. Suitable for lower to middle secondary level students. A study guide accompanies this tape.

results.title: Probability 2
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Associates and ACCESS
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mathematics for modern living”.
This episode from the “Mathematics for modern living” series is a continuation of “Probability 1” (see 309029) and covers the areas of; formulas for finding permutations of n, probability of two mutually exclusive events and two independent events. Suitable for lower to middle secondary level students. A study guide accompanies this tape.

results.title: Probability 1 : counting techniques
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Associates and ACCESS
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mathematics for modern living”.
This episode from the “Mathematics for modern living” series introduces the concepts of chance and probability through examples of everyday life. It discusses games of chance and everyday space, closely followed by counting techniques. Suitable for lower to middle secondary level students. A study guide accompanies this tape.

results.title: Energy efficient air
results.creator_credit: Mark Poole, John R. Hipwell, Commonwealth Department of Primary Industries and Energy and Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Energy management in commercial buildings”.
Designed as one of a series of videos commissioned by the Commonwealth Department of Primary Industries and Energy and the Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria, this video looks at ways commercial building owners, operators and managers can save energy and the environment. This episode looks at practical ways to reduce the energy consumption of air conditioning systems.

results.title: The Energy audit
results.creator_credit: Mark Poole, John R. Hipwell, Commonwealth Department of Primary Industries and Energy and Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Energy management in commercial buildings”.
Designed as part of a series of videos outlining practical ways to measure energy use in commercial buildings, this video concentrates on conducting an energy audit. In turn, this will help the building manager in completing an energy management program with the aim of identifying opportunities for energy cost saving.

results.title: The Energy management program
results.creator_credit: Mark Poole, John R. Hipwell, Commonwealth Department of Primary Industries and Energy and Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Energy management in commercial buildings”.
This video is part of “The Energy management program” commissioned by the Commonwealth Department of Primary Industries and Energy and the Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria. In this episode interviews are conducted with energy managers who have proven they can reduce costs while at the same time improving building comfort and helping the environment.

results.title: Energy efficient light
results.creator_credit: Mark Poole, John R. Hipwell, Commonwealth Department of Primary Industries and Energy and Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Energy management in commercial buildings”.
Designed as one of a series of videos commissioned by the Commonwealth Department of Primary Industries and Energy and the Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria, this video looks at ways commercial building owners, operators and managers can save energy and the environment. This episode looks at lighting consumption and illumination, lamps, lighting and luminairies. Control systems are explored as well as effective strategies for improving the efficiency of existing systems and energy efficient alternatives.

results.title: Painter and poet: an experiment in words, music and paintings
results.creator_credit: Joan Maude, John Halas, Michael Warre and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: A four part series, containing a total of 8 short films for which contempory British painters were commissioned to script in picture, a poem. Each film is accompanied by music and narrated by English performers. The films were produced by John Halas in association with Joan Maude and Michael Warre who devised the script in co-operation with the painters.
results.title_for_label: Painter and poet: an experiment in words, music and paintings
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joan Maude, John Halas, Michael Warre and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films

results.title: John Gilpin
results.creator_credit: Joan Maude, John Halas, Michael Warne, British Film Institute and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Painter and poet: an experiment in words, music and paintings”.
The fourth and final part of a series devised by Joan Maude and Michael Warre incorporating the works of writers, painters and musicians to create an experimental animated film. This part consists of one short film. ‘John Gilpin’ by William Cowper, narrated by Cecil Trouncer, drawings by Ronald Searle (9:00 mins). Photography by W. Traylor and R. Turk, music by Matyas Seiber, edited by Jack King.
